intro: Hieracium medusae, commonly known as the giant devil's paintbrush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a single, upright head. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant's structure includes a stout, hairy stem and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It is often found in alpine environments, where it adapts to cold and harsh climatic conditions.
